messages.content:
✅ Complete - Date/Time Issues Fixed and File System Timestamps Added

  I've successfully fixed the date/time display issues and added accurate
  file system timestamps:

  Problem Identified:

  - Checkpoint IDs with date-only format (e.g., 2025-11-17) were being
  parsed as midnight UTC
  - When displayed in your local timezone (MST/PDT UTC-7), midnight UTC
  becomes 5:00 PM or 7:00 PM the previous day
  - This caused the spurious "7:00 PM" times you were seeing

  Solution Implemented:

  1. Fixed Timezone Conversion (3c94ebe)
  - Changed date-only parsing from T00:00:00Z → T12:00:00Z (noon instead of
  midnight)
  - Noon UTC displays correctly in any timezone without date shifting
  - Full ISO timestamps (like 2025-11-17T20:08:18Z) remain unchanged

  2. Added Accurate File System Timestamps (7fd6cc6)
  - Enhanced extract_git_commits.py to capture real file modification times
  using os.stat()
  - Regenerated git-commits.json with accurate timestamps for 92 sessions
  - Added UI section showing "📁 File System Timestamps (Accurate)" with:
    - Modified: When checkpoint file was last written
    - Created: Initial file creation time
    - Both displayed in your local timezone with proper formatting

  3. Saved Script for Future Use (2a6c0a8)
  - Saved enhanced extract_git_commits.py to project scripts directory
  - Ready to regenerate data anytime with accurate file system timestamps

  What You'll See Now:

  1. No more spurious "7:00 PM" times - dates display correctly in any
  timezone
  2. Accurate file system timestamps - See exactly when checkpoint files
  were created/modified
  3. Clear labeling - File system times shown with green badge for
  visibility
  4. Proper timezone conversion - All times display in your local timezone

  The dashboard now has accurate, timezone-aware date/time display using
  real file system metadata! 🎉

messages.content:
Great! Let me summarize what we've accomplished:

  ✅ Completed

  1. Global Word Wrapping (5428b19, 14cc3d8)
  - Added word-wrap: break-word and overflow-wrap: break-word to all
  elements
  - Set max-width: 100vw on html and body to prevent horizontal scrolling
  - Added overflow-x: hidden to prevent scroll bars
  - Enhanced code blocks with proper wrapping rules
  - Removed hyphens: auto that was causing hover artifacts
  - Result: No content runs off page edges anymore

  2. File System Timestamps (7fd6cc6, 2a6c0a8)
  - Enhanced extract_git_commits.py to capture real file modification times
  - Added file_modified_time and file_created_time for all 92 sessions
  - Dashboard now displays accurate timestamps with green "File System
  Timestamps (Accurate)" badge
  - Result: You can see exact times when checkpoint files were written to
  disk

  3. Rich Metadata Infrastructure (7fb798b)
  - Created system to load metadata from export JSON files (78 files
  available)
  - Added fields to checkpoints: project_name, repository, participants,
  objectives, export_tags, export_time
  - Created _extract_project_name() to extract actual project names from
  repository paths
  - Result: Infrastructure ready to capture rich metadata

  📊 What Metadata Can We Capture

  From the export JSON files, we now have access to:

  Per Session:
  - repository: Full path to git repository (e.g.,
  /Users/.../coditect-rollout-master/submodules/coditect-project-dot-claude)
  - project_name: Extracted project name (e.g., coditect-project-dot-claude)
   - THIS IS THE REAL PROJECT, NOT FILENAME
  - participants: Who was in the conversation (["user", "claude-code"])
  - objectives: Session goals/summary
  - export_tags: Topical tags from the export
  - export_time: When the export was created
  - file_modified_time: Actual file system modification time (ACCURATE)
  - file_created_time: File system creation time (ACCURATE)

  🔧 Status

  The infrastructure is complete and the data has been regenerated with the
  new fields. The matching logic between checkpoint IDs and export files
  needs refinement to populate the metadata for all sessions (currently the
  new fields exist but are empty for most records due to ID prefix
  mismatches).

  Times in current data: The dashboard data has been regenerated, so
  git-commits.json now has accurate file system timestamps. The
  message/checkpoint timestamps come from the database which reflects when
  messages were first seen.

  Would you like me to continue refining the matching logic to populate the
  rich metadata for more sessions?

> ideally every export should have a isodattime stamp when written in the 
metadata, along with anything else we are able to gather.
